file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 20-20-03-07 - FLAP TRACKS - CLEANING/PAINTING

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL FLAP TRACKS - CLEANING/PAINTING EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to clean the flap tracks in the inboard flap, outboard flap, and wing. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 20-20-03-100-801-A FLAP TRACKS - CLEANING EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 20-20-03 Page 1 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 20-20-03-100-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. FLAP TRACKS - CLEANING A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to clean all flap tracks. (2) The flap tracks are made of titanium. Chemical products which contain chlorinated solvent can damage the parts. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION ENERGIZATION OF THE AIRCRAFT WITH AN EX- AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200 TERNAL POWER SOURCE C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Safety Goggles Eye Protection 1 available Commercially Paper Respirator Respiration Protection 1 available Commercially Rubber Gloves Skin Protection 1 available Commercially Cloth, Lint-Free Aircraft Cleaning AR available F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) TT-I-735 Isopropyl Alcohol AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Wing trailing edge EMB-145 - AMM 1285 100-801-A/700 20-20-03 Page 2 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Make sure that the aircraft is safe for maintenance. (2) Energize the aircraft with External DC Power Supply ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801- A/200). WARNING: • MAKE SURE THAT THERE ARE NO PERSONS AND/OR EQUIPMENT IN THE FLAP TRAVEL AREA. • MAKE SURE THAT THE INBOARD-FLAP LOWER SHROUD IS CLOSED. (3) Set the flaps to the 45-degree position. (4) Deenergize the aircraft. J. Cleaning of the Flap Tracks (Figure 701) SUBTASK 110-002-A CAUTION: DO NOT USE ANY CHEMICAL PRODUCTS WHICH CONTAIN CHLORINATED SOLVENT. (1) See that the flap tracks are dirty. (2) If necessary, clean tracks 1 to 10 of the LH and RH wings, as shown in Figure 701. Use a lint-free cloth moist with Isopropyl Alcohol. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Energize the aircraft with External DC Power Supply ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801- A/200). WARNING: • MAKE SURE THAT THERE ARE NO PERSONS AND/OR EQUIPMENT IN THE FLAP TRAVEL AREA. • MAKE SURE THAT THE INBOARD-FLAP LOWER SHROUD IS CLOSED. (2) Set the flaps to the zero-degree position. (3) Deenergize the aircraft. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 100-801-A/700 20-20-03 Page 3 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Flap Tracks - Location Figure 701 A A 10 7 9 6 4 3 1 8 5 1 DET. A 2 DO NOT APPLY GREASE ON THE SURFACE OF THE TRACKS. 1 MAKE SURE THAT THE SURFACE OF THE TRACKS IS CLEAN.
